summary: Gatesin is a coastal port of roughly 7,537 people in the state of Gatesinia. Its quays and warehouses serve as a busy gateway for goods moving into and out of the state, with harbor pilots guiding ships through shifting shallows and a vigilant customs office keeping tariffs and manifests in order.

factions.name: Harbor Master's Office
factions.motive: Maintain safe passage and collect lawful tariffs for Gatesinia
factions.strength: Legal authority, signal beacons, detailed harbor logs

factions.name: Stevedores' Brotherhood
factions.motive: Fair wages, steady work, and safe conditions on the docks
factions.strength: Control of dock labor and the ability to slow or speed cargo flow

factions.name: Saltwind Mariners' Syndicate
factions.motive: Profitable freight contracts and reliable turnaround for their ships
factions.strength: A fleet of coastal vessels, pooled coin, and influence with captains

factions.name: Shrine of the Tidelights
factions.motive: Protect sailors and appease the sea’s temper through rites and counsel
factions.strength: Moral sway over crews and a charitable network among waterfront families

factions.name: The Quiet Quay
factions.motive: Slip untaxed goods through Gatesin to eager buyers inland
factions.strength: Hidden store-rooms, informants on night watches, and small, swift boats

notables.name: Kessa Dorn
notables.secret: Keeps a private chart of a narrow fair-weather channel used to divert selected ships away from inspection during storms

notables.name: Old Brannik
notables.role: Dockside foreman of the Stevedores' Brotherhood
notables.secret: Takes quiet payments to reshuffle crews and delay rivals’ cargo at critical moments

notables.name: Sera Valewake
notables.role: Keeper of the Shrine of the Tidelights
notables.secret: Believes an omen in the tide patterns warns of a looming accident in the outer roads and is hiding the specifics to avoid panic

notables.name: Master Helvar Tross
notables.role: Chair of the Saltwind Mariners' Syndicate
notables.secret: Heavily leveraged on a speculative grain run; a missed arrival could bankrupt several member captains

notables.name: Mouse Jerrin
notables.role: Streetwise runner for the Quiet Quay
notables.secret: Carries a ledger naming a state official who buys seized goods off the books

adventureHooks.title: The Sandbar Shift
adventureHooks.setup: A recent storm has shifted the harbor’s outer sandbars, and pilots need help placing new markers before fully laden ships arrive.
adventureHooks.complication: Smugglers want the confusion to continue and sabotage marker buoys under cover of fog.
adventureHooks.reward: Harbor Master’s favor and a temporary exemption from certain docking fees

adventureHooks.title: Tariffs and Tempers
adventureHooks.setup: A fresh schedule of tariffs from Gatesinia angers shipowners and dockworkers, threatening to stall trade.
adventureHooks.complication: A forged directive circulates to inflame unrest; finding its source reveals a plot to trigger a riot at the customs house.
adventureHooks.reward: Access to a bonded warehouse and expedited paperwork for future cargo

adventureHooks.title: False Lights
adventureHooks.setup: Ships report misleading signals at night drawing them off the safe approach to Gatesin.
adventureHooks.complication: A covert crew uses decoy lanterns from a derelict pier to cause groundings and strip cargo in the confusion.
adventureHooks.reward: Salvage rights on recovered goods and a standing contract to patrol the approaches

adventureHooks.title: The Missing Pilot
adventureHooks.setup: One of the senior harbor pilots vanishes on the eve of guiding a high-value freighter into port.
adventureHooks.complication: Clues point to a warehouse used by the Quiet Quay, where the pilot is pressured to reveal back-channel routes.
adventureHooks.reward: Syndicate payment for safeguarding the freighter and a cut of the docking profits
